metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1915 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ModSecurity before 2.7.3 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files, send HTTP requests to intranet servers, or cause a denial of service (CPU and memory consumption) via an XML external entity declaration in conjunction with an entity reference, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-security2 - 2.6.6-6
libapache2-modsecurity - 2.6.6-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: modsecurity-apache package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.6-6').
